title: Pentafa
author: Pentafa
content: Is there a reliable Bitcoin exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer?

comments.author: smartaction
comments.body: Quote from: Pentafa on October 19, 2022, 04:17:37 AMIs there a reliable Bitcoin exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer?I don’t know where are you from but i can suggest you to use p2p trading . you can use Binance p2p it is very first and there are active buyers available . you can sell your crypto there instantly by any Payment method like mobile banking , paypal , Bank Transfer by NPSB etc..

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Quote from: smartaction on October 19, 2022, 05:39:40 AMQuote from: Pentafa on October 19, 2022, 04:17:37 AMIs there a reliable Bitcoin exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer?I don’t know where are you from but i can suggest you to use p2p trading . you can use Binance p2p it is very first and there are active buyers available . you can sell your crypto there instantly by any Payment method like mobile banking , paypal , Bank Transfer by NPSB etc..The question of the OP is straightforward enough, he needs an answer on "an exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer." I believe P2P is not the right answer because apart from the fact that it is not a Swift Bank transfer, how many of them engaging in it would be able to complete a transaction of $20M for example? So, the OP knows why we made it unlimited, but I don't think such exists as of today. I have even helped the OP to search the internet and also asked questions from the crypto guru I know to avoid mistakes, but to no avail.

comments.author: smartaction
comments.body: Quote from: EarnOnVictor on October 19, 2022, 05:54:19 AMQuote from: smartaction on October 19, 2022, 05:39:40 AMQuote from: Pentafa on October 19, 2022, 04:17:37 AMIs there a reliable Bitcoin exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer?I don’t know where are you from but i can suggest you to use p2p trading . you can use Binance p2p it is very first and there are active buyers available . you can sell your crypto there instantly by any Payment method like mobile banking , paypal , Bank Transfer by NPSB etc..The question of the OP is straightforward enough, he needs an answer on "an exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer." I believe P2P is not the right answer because apart from the fact that it is not a Swift Bank transfer, how many of them engaging in it would be able to complete a transaction of $20M for example? So, the OP knows why we made it unlimited, but I don't think such exists as of today. I have even helped the OP to search the internet and also asked questions from the crypto guru I know to avoid mistakes, but to no avail.ops I was drinking this morning so I saw a bit wrong and wrote a bit wrong.  Now I'm over the addiction and I understand it.  thank you mate. if op ask for SWIFT bank transfer ,Such a exchanger still haven’t  to my knowledge . which Exchange can give him the opportunity of unlimited  SWIFT

comments.author: Pentafa
comments.body: [/quote]The question of the OP is straightforward enough, he needs an answer on "an exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer." I believe P2P is not the right answer because apart from the fact that it is not a Swift Bank transfer, how many of them engaging in it would be able to complete a transaction of $20M for example? So, the OP knows why we made it unlimited, but I don't think such exists as of today. I have even helped the OP to search the internet and also asked questions from the crypto guru I know to avoid mistakes, but to no avail.[/quote]How reliable is Bitstamp?

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Pentafa on October 19, 2022, 04:17:37 AMIs there a reliable Bitcoin exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer?I am not sure that you will find a reliable exchange that doesn't have any limits at all, but I do know that daily withdrawal limit on Binance for those that went through standard  KYC is $2 million. It can be increased further but for that you have to go through AML.Quote from: Pentafa on October 19, 2022, 06:56:09 AMHow reliable is Bitstamp?Bistamp is pretty reliable exchange. Never tried it myself, but few of my friends are using it for years and I never heard them complaining about it.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: If you're planning on buying very large amounts, then OTC (Over-the-counter) platforms might be a way better solution than using traditional exchanges: Kraken's OTC, ItBit, etc.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: Pentafa on October 19, 2022, 06:56:09 AMHow reliable is Bitstamp?Bitstamp is one of the oldest exchanges, but I can't guarantee its reliability after seeing the trustpilot reviews. Maybe you have to go through KYC for unlimited withdrawals. Binance also supports SWIFT bank transfer withdrawals, just check if your country is not one of the excluded ones. Note: KYC is mandatory to use Binance.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: noorman0 on October 19, 2022, 07:39:12 AM-snip-Note: KYC is mandatory to use Binance.When dealing with fiat, you have to verify your identity regardless of the exchange platform and the amount you're trading.

comments.author: Tytanowy Janusz
comments.body: there is 2 mln $ daily withdrawal limit after standard KYC and 100 mln $ per transaction and unlimited per account per day on binance after compliting advanced KYC with "Source of Wealth Declaration". You wan't get any better than that if you are looking for reliable exchange - unilimited per day limited to 100 mln $ per transaction.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: Pentafa on October 19, 2022, 04:17:37 AMIs there a reliable Bitcoin exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer?Since you're unlikely not getting an exchange that can perform this required swift withdrawal at a glance, why not make it within a couple of days, just an advise and only if that transaction you wanted to perform is not above the $2 million daily limit you can perform on exchange like Binance as mentioned except the thorough subjection to KYC and AML can give you access to perform such and which is also under a probability, but if I were you, I'd rather do it little by little than louding myself out to the public.

comments.author: KaliLinux
comments.body: Quote from: Pentafa on October 19, 2022, 04:17:37 AMIs there a reliable Bitcoin exchange with unlimited withdrawals via SWIFT bank transfer?  OP is trying to bring down the price of Bitcoin or is this just for discussion and knowledge purposes? thinking about it now though, how do millionaires/Billioniers like Michael Saylor, Elon Musk, and the likes buy their many Bitcoins? through the exchange like the rest of us? Quote from: Tytanowy Janusz on October 19, 2022, 07:55:46 AMthere is 2 mln $ daily withdrawal limit after standard KYC and 100 mln $ per transaction and unlimited per account per day on binance after compliting advanced KYC with "Source of Wealth Declaration". You wan't get any better than that if you are looking for reliable exchange - unilimited per day limited to 100 mln $ per transaction. From all I have read thus far, I think this is the best option for OP in terms of what you are looking for, $100mil at the current price is about 5200+BTC  you have to dump to withdraw that kind of amount

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: noorman0 on October 19, 2022, 07:39:12 AMBitstamp is one of the oldest exchanges, but I can't guarantee its reliability after seeing the trustpilot reviews. I wouldn't put too much trust (to be more precise none) into Trustpilot reviews, both positive and negative as there are so many services that offer fake reviews there. Quote from: KaliLinux on October 19, 2022, 08:33:13 AMthinking about it now though, how do millionaires/Billioniers like Michael Saylor, Elon Musk, and the likes buy their many Bitcoins? through the exchange like the rest of us? Nope, those big players don't use exchanges like majority of us and instead they do it via OTC.

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: Bitpanda and Nexo (yes, it's sort of an exchange now) offer both those, depending on your account levels, but I would imagine there are certain thresholds when they'll start asking you to pay or to jump through additional hoops. I'm probably a very average user, and I mainly do p2p, but for small and non-urgent amounts I sometimes use either to do SEPA/SWIFT, it's free of cost (with a small min limit) but again, I have never tried doing it frequently.*definitely NOT a recommendation, merely an answer*
